alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Central; Baldwin Coastal (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 8:46AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Baldwin and south central Escambia Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 846 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Magnolia Springs, or 8 miles south of Point Clear, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Foley, Orange Beach, Lillian, Magnolia Springs, Bon Secour, Summerdale and Elberta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for southwestern Alabama...and northwestern Florida.
